title: Tab v2 Model Selector and Bug Fixes
description: Released February 4, 2026 - Released Tab v2 model selector to all users with various bug fixes and performance improvements. Fixed Arena Mode Battle Groups issues on February 3.

community_feedback.quote: Plan mode, model choice, and wasted tokens - user discussing issues with megaplan and codex 5.2 xhigh for ML Python project

title: Wave 14: Arena Mode and Plan Mode
description: Released January 30, 2026 - Arena Mode brings side-by-side model comparison with hidden model identities, Battle Groups, personal and global leaderboards. Plan Mode creates detailed implementation plans before coding.

community_feedback.quote: One prompt. Two models. Your vote - Benchmarks don't reflect real-world coding quality
Arena Mode runs two AI models on the same prompt side-by-side, so you can compare their responses

title: Claude in Chrome (Beta) and Cowork with Plugins
description: Released Claude in Chrome (Beta) allowing browser control directly from Claude Code, and Cowork with Plugins released on January 30 for customization.

community_feedback.quote: First impressions of Claude Cowork - discussion thread on HackerNews

title: Daily Benchmarks Fix and Harness Rollback
description: Fixed a Claude Code harness issue that was introduced on 1/26 and rolled back on 1/28. Users advised to run `claude update`.

title: Copilot CLI Preview
description: GitHub Copilot CLI is now in preview, offering agentic power in the terminal with the ability to build, debug, and deploy without leaving the terminal. Includes GitHub MCP by default.

community_feedback.quote: Discussion about which models everyone is using in February 2026

title: Prompt Files Feature
description: Save and reuse prompt files to get faster, more consistent responses from GitHub Copilot with the new Prompt Files feature.

title: Devin Review Launch and Repo Setup AI
description: Released January 22, 2026 - Devin Review provides reimagined interface for understanding complex PRs with smart grouping, copy/move detection, and bug catching. Repository setup flow now includes AI-powered suggestions for setup commands.

community_feedback.quote: Thoughts on a month with Devin - users shared experiences including concerns about companies that 'went all in on AI engineers, only to realize two months later that their codebase was rotting'
Devin is more akin to a 'super-advanced intern' rather than an autonomous senior engineer - requires significant supervision

title: Sessions API Enhancements
description: Released January 22, 2026 - New API endpoints allow retrieving session details by ID, sending messages to active sessions, and filtering sessions by origin (webapp, Slack, Teams, API, Linear, Jira).

title: GPT-5.1-Codex-Max and Agent Mode
description: Released November 19, 2025 - Introduced GPT-5.1-Codex-Max frontier agentic coding model with higher reliability and faster iteration. Windows Agent mode with experimental sandbox introduced.

title: Credits on ChatGPT Pro and Plus
description: Released October 30, 2025 - Codex users on ChatGPT Plus and Pro can now use on-demand credits for more Codex usage beyond what's included in their plan.
